thread.title: U.K. stocks jump on hopes deal for Greece is closer
thread.title_full: U.K. stocks jump on hopes deal for Greece is closer - MarketWatch

author: By     Carla Mozee
title: U.K. stocks jump on hopes deal for Greece is closer
text:
U.K. stocks ran higher Friday, with British Airways’s parent climbing as it moved closer to acquiring Aer Lingus, and as investors appeared hopeful that Greece will reach a bailout deal with creditors.
The FTSE 100 UKX, +1.39% gained 1.4% to 6,673.38. The blue-chip index posted a weekly rise of 1.3%.
U.K. stocks rallied along with European equities SXXP, +2.03% after Greece late Thursday submitted 13 pages of economic policy overhauls and budget cuts that, if approved, could unlock much-needed bailout funds.
A deal would also steer Greece away from the brink of leaving the eurozone, which is the U.K.’s largest trading partner.
“The proposal submitted by Greece this time does seem to have a real strong foundation, and it appears that they have taken a massive step back on the thorniest issues”, which previously led to the breakdown of negotiations, Naeem Aslam, chief market analyst, at AvaTrade, said in a note.
If creditors accept the new proposal, “we are expecting a massive rally for the equity market going forward and the next major concern for the market will be Chinese selloff, not the Greek saga,” added Aslam.
Greek debt crisis: Latest news
A decision on the proposal could come as early as Friday, said Jeroen Dijsselbloem, the head of the eurozone finance ministers, according to a Bloomberg report. The new proposal, however, could face opposition in Greece.
The timetable for deciding Greece’s fate in the euro
Movers: InterContinental Hotels Group PLC IHG, +3.07% IHG, +4.57% rose 3.1% after it said it would sell InterContinental Hong Kong to a consortium of buyers for $938 million.
Shares of International Consolidated Airlines Group IAG, +3.21% rose 3.2%, after rival airline operator Ryanair Holdings PLC RY4B, +1.89% said Friday that it would sell its Aer Lingus stake to the group. That brings the British Airways’s parent closer to a takeover of Irish rival Aer Lingus Group PLC EIL1, +2.27% Aer Lingus was up 2.3% and Ryanair shares gained 1.9%.
Smith & Nephew PLC SN., +0.90% shares rose 0.9% after the medical-equipment maker said it’s purchased the trauma and orthopedics business of DeOst LLC and DC LLC. Financial terms weren’t disclosed.
Standard Life PLC SL., +4.22% and St. James Place PLC STJ, +3.82% rose 4.5% and 3.8%, respectively following price-target upgrades for the insurers at Barclays.
ARM Holdings PLC ARM, -2.87% shares fell 2.9%, with the chip designer feeling the weight of worries about slowing in the smartphone market.
